translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, having established the Dharma, teach the Dharma to beings.

original: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam la spyod pas /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the path to awakening

original: thog ma nyid du 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: thog ma nyid du 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: First, one should thoroughly investigate as follows:

original: mngon par 'du bya ba ma gtogs par 'di la chos gang yang ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs su med @345b do; ;zhes bya bar yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba ma gtogs par 'di la chos gang yang ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs su med @345b do; ;zhes bya bar yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: “Apart from the process of formation, no phenomenon whatsoever is perceived in its own intrinsic reality.”🔽Thus, one should thoroughly investigate.

original: de chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la de ltar rtog pas /
analyzed: de chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la de ltar rtog pas /
translated: “When one investigates the intrinsic reality of all phenomena in this way,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: is the perfection of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: the perfection of moral discipline,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: the perfection of diligence,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyi pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyi pa'am /
translated: the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: or the perfection of wisdom;

original: nang stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dam /
translated: is inner emptiness,

original: phyi stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid dam /
translated: outer emptiness,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid dam /
translated: inner and outer emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dam /
translated: or the emptiness of emptiness;

original: chen po stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid dam /
translated: is the emptiness of great extent,

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid dam /🔽'dus byas stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid dam / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of ultimate reality,🔽the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dam /
translated: or the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena;

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dam /🔽thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dam / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness that transcends extremes,🔽the emptiness of what is beginningless and endless,

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of nonrejection,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of inherent existence,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of all phenomena,🔽the emptiness of intrinsic characteristics,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dam; mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dam; mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dam /
translated: the emptiness of nonobservation,

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dam /🔽ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dam / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dam /

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dam /
translated: and the emptiness of the essential nature of nonentities.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'am /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'am /
translated: “It is the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi'am /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi'am /
translated: the four right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi'am /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi'am /
translated: the four legs of miraculous power,

original: dbang po lnga'am /
analyzed: dbang po lnga'am /
translated: the five faculties,🔽the five powers,

original: stobs lnga'am / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun nam /
analyzed: stobs lnga'am / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun nam /
translated: the seven branches of enlightenment,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'am /
translated: the noble eightfold path,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'am /
translated: the four noble truths,

original: bsam gtan bzhi'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi'am /
translated: the four concentrations,

original: tshad med pa bzhi'am /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi'am /
translated: the four immeasurables,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'am /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'am /
translated: and the four formless absorptions.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dam /🔽mthar gyis gnas pa'i @346a *//
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dam / mthar gyis gnas pa'i @346a *//

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'am /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'am /
translated: the nine serial absorptions,🔽the emptiness gate of liberation,🔽the signless gate of liberation,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'am /
translated: the wishless gate of liberation,

original: mngon par shes pa rnams sam /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams sam /
translated: the clairvoyances,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /
translated: the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams sam /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams sam /
translated: the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'am /
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi'am /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi'am /
translated: the four fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'am /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'am /
translated: the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: byams pa chen po'am /
analyzed: byams pa chen po'am /
translated: great love,

original: snying rje chen po'am /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'am /
translated: great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dam /
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of non-returner,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: the state of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: rang byang chub bam /
translated: a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dam /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dam /
translated: the knowledge of path aspects,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bam /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bam /
translated: or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: chos gang la'ang mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will not settle down on any dharma at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni /

original: ngo bo nyid kyis chos thams cad kyis stong ste /🔽stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis chos thams cad kyis stong ste / stong pa nyid ni /
translated: Because all dharmas are empty of all dharmas.

original: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And emptiness does not settle down on emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang dmigs su med na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang dmigs su med na /
translated: And if emptiness is not apprehended,

original: gang stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
translated: how could there be any settling down on emptiness?

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par chos thams cad kyis rnam par spyod do //🔽de bslab pa 'di la gnas shing sems can 'di dag ci la spyod ces sems can gyi spyod pa la @346b lta ste; de 'di snyam du /🔽kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par chos thams cad kyis rnam par spyod do // de bslab pa 'di la gnas shing sems can 'di dag ci la spyod ces sems can gyi spyod pa la @346b lta ste; de 'di snyam du / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: thus bodhisattva great beings, without settling down on any dharma at all, practice all dharmas.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'dzin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'dzin pa la spyod de /
translated: “Standing in this training, they look at the practice of beings, thinking, ‘What are these beings practicing?’ They think, ‘Alas, these beings are practicing false grasping.

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: Alas, these beings are practicing false grasping.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'dzin pa las dgrol bar bya na dka' ba byed do zhes nas de'i tshe thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'dzin pa las dgrol bar bya na dka' ba byed do zhes nas de'i tshe thabs mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: At that time, with skillful means, he abides in the perfection of wisdom

original: 'di skad du chos ston te //
analyzed: 'di skad du chos ston te //
translated: and teaches the Dharma like this:

original: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /
analyzed: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /
translated: “Come, sentient beings!

original: sbyin pa byin cig des khyed longs spyod dang ldan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sbyin pa byin cig des khyed longs spyod dang ldan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Give gifts. Through that you will have wealth.

original: longs spyod des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: longs spyod des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
translated: But do not be proud because of that wealth.

original: de la snying po gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing substantial in that.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims la 'doms te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims la 'doms te /
translated: ” In the same way, he instructs them in morality:

original: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /
analyzed: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /
translated: “Come, sentient beings!

original: tshul khrims srungs shig /
analyzed: tshul khrims srungs shig /
translated: Protect your morality.

original: tshul khrims des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: tshul khrims des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
translated: But do not be proud because of that morality.

original: de la snying po gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing substantial in that.

original: de bzhin du bzod pa la 'doms te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzod pa la 'doms te /
translated: ” In the same way, he instructs them in patience:

original: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /
analyzed: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /
translated: “Come, sentient beings!

original: bzod pa sgoms shig /
analyzed: bzod pa sgoms shig /
translated: Cultivate patience.

original: bzod pa des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: bzod pa des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
translated: But do not be proud because of that patience.

original: de la snying po gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing substantial in that.🔽”

original: de bzhin du btson 'grus la 'doms te /
analyzed: de bzhin du btson 'grus la 'doms te /
translated: Likewise, they encourage them in perseverance:

original: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /
analyzed: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /

original: brtson 'grus rtsoms shig /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsoms shig /

original: brtson 'grus des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: brtson 'grus des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
translated: But do not be proud because of that perseverance!

original: de la snying po gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing substantial in that!

original: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin la 'doms te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin la 'doms te /
translated: ” Likewise, they encourage them in meditative stabilization:

original: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /
analyzed: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /

original: ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhog cig /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhog cig /

original: ting nge 'dzin des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /

original: de la snying po gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do //

analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab la 'doms te /

original: shes rab sgoms shig /
analyzed: shes rab sgoms shig /

original: shes rab des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: shes rab des kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /

original: de la snying po gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do //

original: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid la 'doms te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid la 'doms te /

original: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /
analyzed: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /

original: nang stong pa nyid sgoms shig /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid sgoms shig /

analyzed: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /

original: de la snying po gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la snying po gang yang med do //

original: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /
analyzed: kye sems can dag tshur sheg /

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid sgoms shig /

analyzed: zhes de de ltar sems can rnams la 'doms pa dang / rjes su ston pa byed cing /
translated: “They encourage and teach beings in this way.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la spyod kyang gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la spyod kyang gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: and even though they practice the bodhisattva path, they do not settle down on anything at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: chos thams cad ni; mngon par zhen pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni; mngon par zhen pa med pa ste /
translated: Because all dharmas are without settling down.

original: de ni / 'di ltar de dag la stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir gang gis mngon par zhen par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid med do ////
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar de dag la stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir gang gis mngon par zhen par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid med do ////
translated: For this reason, there is no intrinsic nature by which they could settle down.

original: shes rab kyi @351b pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //🔽bam po nyis brgya go drug pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi @351b pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa // bam po nyis brgya go drug pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam la spyod kyang gang la'ang mi gnas te; de gnas pa med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam la spyod kyang gang la'ang mi gnas te; de gnas pa med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the bodhisattva path like that do not settle down on anything at all. They practice the perfection of giving without settling down on it, and so on up to they practice the perfection of wisdom without settling down on it.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: They practice the perfection of morality without settling down on it, and so on up to they practice the perfection of giving without settling down on it.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: They practice the perfection of patience, but they do not rest in it.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: They practice the perfection of perseverance, but they do not rest in it.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: They practice the perfection of concentration, but they do not rest in it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: They practice the perfection of wisdom, but they do not rest in it.

original: de bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: They enter into the first concentration, but they do not rest in it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni / 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni / 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po ni /
translated: And why?

original: bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //🔽gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo // gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: Because the first concentration is empty of the intrinsic nature of the first concentration.🔽That which enters into it is also empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //

original: de bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: They enter into the second concentration, but they do not rest in it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni / 'di ltar bsam gtan gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar bsam gtan gnyis pa ni /

original: bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //🔽gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo // gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //

analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo // gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni / 'di ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni / 'di ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ni /

analyzed: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The one who enters into it is also empty by nature.

analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //

original: de rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: He enters the sphere of infinite consciousness, but does not rest in it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni / 'di ltar rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni / 'di ltar rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: Because the sphere of infinite consciousness is empty of the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The one who enters into it is also empty by nature.

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //🔽de cung zad @353a *//
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo // de cung zad @353a *//
translated: The aspects in which one becomes absorbed in concentration are also empty of inherent nature.

original: med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: He enters the sphere of nothingness, but does not dwell on it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni / 'di ltar cung zad med pa'i skye mched ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni / 'di ltar cung zad med pa'i skye mched ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: Because the sphere of nothingness is empty of the inherent nature of the sphere of nothingness.

original: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The one who becomes absorbed in concentration is also empty of inherent nature.

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The aspects in which one becomes absorbed in concentration are also empty of inherent nature.

original: de 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: He enters the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, but does not dwell on it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni / 'di ltar 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni / 'di ltar 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: Because the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is empty of the inherent nature of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The one who enters into meditative stabilization is also empty of inherent nature.

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The aspects by which one enters into meditative stabilization are also empty of inherent nature.

original: de rnam par thar pa brgyad la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de rnam par thar pa brgyad la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: “He enters into the eight liberations, but he does not rest in them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni / 'di ltar rnam par thar pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar rnam par thar pa rnams ni /
translated: It is because the liberations

original: rnam par thar pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //🔽gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo // gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: are empty of the nature of the liberations.🔽The one who enters into meditative stabilization is also empty of inherent nature.

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The aspects by which one enters into meditative stabilization are also empty of inherent nature.

original: de mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: “He enters into the nine serial absorptions, but he does not rest in them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni / 'di ltar mthar gyis gnas pa'i @353b snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar mthar gyis gnas pa'i @353b snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni /
translated: It is because the serial absorptions

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //🔽gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo // gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: the formless absorptions are empty of the intrinsic nature of the formless absorptions;🔽the one who enters into meditative absorption is empty of an intrinsic nature;

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: the aspects in terms of which one enters into meditative absorption are empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into the four applications of mindfulness is empty of an intrinsic nature;

original: de dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni / 'di ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te / de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni / 'di ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni /
translated: the one who enters into the four right efforts is empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into the four legs of miraculous power is empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into the five faculties is empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into the five powers is empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into the seven aspects of enlightenment is empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into the noble eightfold path is empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into the four fearlessnesses is empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into the four detailed and thorough knowledges is empty of an intrinsic nature;

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: the one who enters into the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha is empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into great love is empty of an intrinsic nature;

original: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: the one who enters into great compassion is empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening is empty of an intrinsic nature;

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: the one who enters into the ten powers is empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into the four fearlessnesses is empty of an intrinsic nature;

original: de yang dag par spong ba bzhi la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de yang dag par spong ba bzhi la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: the one who enters into the four detailed and thorough knowledges is empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha is empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into great love is empty of an intrinsic nature;

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: the one who enters into great compassion is empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening is empty of an intrinsic nature;🔽the one who enters into the ten powers is empty of an intrinsic nature;

original: de ni / 'di ltar yang dag par spong ba rnams ni /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar yang dag par spong ba rnams ni /
translated: Because the right efforts

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //🔽gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo // gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: are empty of the nature of the right efforts.🔽The one who becomes absorbed in samādhi is empty of an inherent nature.

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The aspects through which one becomes absorbed in samādhi are empty of an inherent nature.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: “He becomes absorbed in the four supports for miraculous abilities, but he does not rest in them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni / 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni /
translated: Because the four supports for miraculous abilities

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //🔽gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //🔽rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa @354a *//
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo // gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo // rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa @354a *//
translated: are empty of the nature of the four supports for miraculous abilities.🔽The one who becomes absorbed in samādhi is empty of an inherent nature.

original: de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The aspects through which one becomes absorbed in samādhi are empty of an inherent nature.

original: de dbang po lnga la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de dbang po lnga la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: “He becomes absorbed in the five powers, but he does not rest in them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de ni / 'di ltar dbang po rnams ni /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar dbang po rnams ni /
translated: It is because the faculties

original: dbang po rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //🔽gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo // gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: are empty of the nature of the faculties.🔽The one who enters into meditative concentration is also empty of inherent nature.

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The aspects through which one enters into meditative concentration are also empty of inherent nature.

original: de stobs lnga la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de stobs lnga la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: “He enters into the meditative absorption of the five strengths, but he does not rest in them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de ni / 'di ltar stobs rnams ni /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar stobs rnams ni /
translated: It is because the strengths

original: stobs rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //🔽gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: stobs rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo // gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: are empty of the nature of the strengths.🔽The one who enters into meditative concentration is also empty of inherent nature.

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The aspects through which one enters into meditative concentration are also empty of inherent nature.

original: de byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te; de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te; de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “He enters into the meditative absorption of the seven aspects of enlightenment, but he does not rest in them. Why is it so?

original: de ni / 'di ltar byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni /
translated: It is because the aspects of enlightenment🔽are empty of the nature of the aspects of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: the limbs of awakening are empty of the intrinsic nature of the limbs of awakening;

original: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: the one who enters into meditative stabilization is empty of the intrinsic nature of the one who enters into meditative stabilization;

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: the aspects in terms of which one enters into meditative stabilization are empty of the intrinsic nature of those aspects;

original: de 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te; de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te; de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: although he enters into the noble eightfold path, he does not rest in it. And why?

original: de ni / 'di ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni /
translated: Because the noble eightfold path

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: is empty of the intrinsic nature of the noble eightfold path;

original: gang mnyam par gzhog pa @354b de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gang mnyam par gzhog pa @354b de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: the one who enters into meditative stabilization is empty of the intrinsic nature of the one who enters into meditative stabilization;

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: the aspects in terms of which one enters into meditative stabilization are empty of the intrinsic nature of those aspects;

original: de 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: although he enters into the four noble truths, he does not rest in them. And why?

original: de ni / 'di ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams ni /
translated: It is thus: the noble truths

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //🔽gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo // gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: are empty of the intrinsic nature of the noble truths.🔽The meditative absorption in which one enters is also empty of intrinsic nature.

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The aspects through which one enters meditative absorption are also empty of intrinsic nature.

original: de rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: Although one enters the meditative absorption of the emptiness gate of liberation, the signless gate of liberation, and the wishless gate of liberation, one does not abide in them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni / 'di ltar rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ni /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ni /
translated: It is thus: the emptiness gate of liberation, the signless gate of liberation, and the wishless gate of liberation

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: are empty of the intrinsic nature of the emptiness gate of liberation, the signless gate of liberation, and the wishless gate of liberation.

original: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The meditative absorption in which one enters is also empty of intrinsic nature.

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The aspects in which one is concentrated are also empty of inherent nature.

original: de mngon par shes pa rnams la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa rnams la snyoms par 'jug kyang de la mi gnas te /
translated: “He enters the absorptions and the liberations, but he does not rest in them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni / 'di ltar mngon par shes pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar mngon par shes pa rnams ni /
translated: It is because the absorptions and the liberations

original: mngon par shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //🔽gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo // gang mnyam par gzhog pa de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: are empty of the nature of the absorptions and the liberations.🔽The one who enters them is also empty of inherent nature.

original: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnam pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The aspects in which one is concentrated are also empty of inherent nature.

original: de @355a *// rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de @355a *// rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: “He attains the fruit of entering the stream, but he does not rest in it.

original: de lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: He attains the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, but he does not rest in it.

original: de phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: He attains the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, but he does not rest in it.

original: de dgra bcom pa nyid thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de dgra bcom pa nyid thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: He attains arhatship, but he does not rest in it.

original: de rang byang chub thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de rang byang chub thob kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: Even when they attain the pratyekabuddha’s awakening, they do not remain there.

original: gsol pa / ci'i slad du mi gnas /
analyzed: gsol pa / ci'i slad du mi gnas /
translated: ” The bodhisattva asked, “Why do they not remain there?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir mi gnas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir mi gnas te /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “They do not remain there for two reasons.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are those two?

original: ngo bo nyid dang / ngo bo nyid med pa ste /🔽de gnyis kyi phyir gang la gnas pa'am /🔽gang gis gnas pa'am /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / ngo bo nyid med pa ste / de gnyis kyi phyir gang la gnas pa'am / gang gis gnas pa'am /
translated: They are the intrinsic nature and the absence of intrinsic nature.🔽For these two reasons, those results do not exist in any way that one could remain there,🔽by which one could remain there,

original: gang gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu de dag la med do //
analyzed: gang gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu de dag la med do //
translated: or that one could remain there.

original: de tsam gyis dga' bar yang mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis dga' bar yang mi 'dzin te /
translated: They do not take delight in that alone.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de 'di snyam du bdag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de 'di snyam du bdag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Because they think, ‘I should not fail to attain the result of stream enterer,

original: de la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: but I should not remain there.

original: bdag gis lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par mi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par mi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: I should not fail to attain the result of once-returner,

original: de la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: but I should not remain there.

original: bdag gis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par mi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par mi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: I should not fail to attain the result of non-returner,

original: bdag gis ni /
analyzed: bdag gis ni /
translated: I have not given rise to any other thought than the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽I have not given rise to any other thought than the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sa bcu pa nas nye bar bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ma gtogs par sems gzhan gang yang ma bskyed do //
analyzed: sa bcu pa nas nye bar bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ma gtogs par sems gzhan gang yang ma bskyed do //
translated: From the time of their first production of the thought of awakening, they do not produce any other thought than the thought of awakening, up to the time when they sit at the site of awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ma gtogs par sems gzhan gang yang ma bskyed do //

translated: From the time they enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva, they do not produce any other thought than the thought of awakening, up to the time when they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: snyam ste / rab 'byor /
analyzed: snyam ste / rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /

analyzed: sems g-yeng ba med par lus sam / ngag gam / yid kyis gang spyod kyang rung ste /

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis mi spyod pa med de /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis mi spyod pa med de / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /

original: byang chub kyi sems la gnas nas yid g-yeng ba med par byang chub kyi lam sgrub bo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la gnas nas yid g-yeng ba med par byang chub kyi lam sgrub bo //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings, standing in the thought of awakening, accomplish the path to awakening without distraction.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: gal te chos thams cad ma skyes pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad ma skyes pa lags na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @356b chen pos byang chub kyi lam ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /

analyzed: ma skyes pa ste /

analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: whether the thus-gone ones appear or not,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de bzhin du gnas pa ma lags sam /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de bzhin du gnas pa ma lags sam /
translated: the intrinsic nature of phenomena remains just as it is, does it not?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /

original: chos rnams kyi gnas nyid ni /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi gnas nyid ni /

original: de bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas so //

original: de la'ang gang chos kyi gnas nyid de lta bu mi shes pa de dag gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam bskyed de /
analyzed: de la'ang gang chos kyi gnas nyid de lta bu mi shes pa de dag gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam bskyed de /
translated: For the sake of those who do not know the suchness of dharmas, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva generates the path to awakening.

original: lam des sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar byed do //
analyzed: lam des sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar byed do //

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: ci lags / skyes par gyur pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lags sam /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ma yin no //

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: 'o na ma skyes pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lags sam /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ma yin no //

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'o na skyes kyang skyes la ma skyes @357a *//
translated: ” He said, “Bhagavān,

original: kyang ma skyes pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lags sam /
analyzed: kyang ma skyes pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lags sam /
translated: is awakening attained through a path that has arisen and not arisen?🔽” The Bhagavān said, “No.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ma yin no //
translated: The Blessed One said, “No.”🔽

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽'o na skyes pa'ang ma lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / 'o na skyes pa'ang ma lags /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Blessed One,

analyzed: ma skyes pa'ang ma lags pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lags sam / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: is awakening attained through a path that is neither produced nor not produced?”

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; 'o na byang chub ji ltar thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; 'o na byang chub ji ltar thob par 'gyur /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub ni /🔽lam gyis thob pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub ni / lam gyis thob pa'ang ma yin /
translated: awakening

original: lam ma yin pas thob pa'ang ma yin te; byang chub nyid kyang lam mo //
analyzed: lam ma yin pas thob pa'ang ma yin te; byang chub nyid kyang lam mo //
translated: is not attained through a path, nor is it attained through a non-path. Awakening itself is the path,

original: lam nyid kyang byang chub bo //
analyzed: lam nyid kyang byang chub bo //
translated: and the path itself is awakening.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti asked, “Blessed One,

original: gal te de ltar byang chub nyid kyang lam la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar byang chub nyid kyang lam la /
translated: if awakening is the path,

original: lam nyid kyang byang chub lags na /
analyzed: lam nyid kyang byang chub lags na /
translated: and the path is awakening,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub snga nas thob par 'gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub snga nas thob par 'gyur na /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One is described as having the thirty-two major marks of a great person, the eighty minor marks, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of exact knowledge,

original: thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis brjod do //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis brjod do //
translated: great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of a buddha.

original: zhes kyang ci'i slad du bstan /
analyzed: zhes kyang ci'i slad du bstan /
translated: Why is that also taught?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sangs rgyas shig byang @357b chub thob par byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas shig byang @357b chub thob par byed pa yin nam /
translated: Is it a buddha who causes the attainment of awakening?”🔽He replied,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ni / ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni / ma lags so //
translated: it is not.

original: sangs rgyas ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni /
translated: A buddha

original: byang chub thob par mi mdzad de /🔽sangs rgyas nyid kyang byang chub bo //
analyzed: byang chub thob par mi mdzad de / sangs rgyas nyid kyang byang chub bo //
translated: does not cause the attainment of awakening.🔽Buddhahood itself is awakening.

original: byang chub nyid kyang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: byang chub nyid kyang sangs rgyas so //
translated: Awakening itself is buddhahood.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / gang khyod kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang khyod kyis 'di skad du /
translated: Subhuti: If, O Lord, the Bodhisattva, the great being, has not fully known the utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment before, how then can he be called a Bodhisattva, a great being?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub snga nas thob par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes smras pa; rab 'byor /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas /🔽tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas; bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas /🔽brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas /🔽bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas /🔽nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /🔽phyi stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub snga nas thob par 'gyur ro // zhes smras pa; rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas; bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas / nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas / phyi stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: The Lord: Here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, has fully known the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of vigour, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of wisdom.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He has fully known the inner emptiness, the outer emptiness, the emptiness of both inner and outer, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of the compounded, the emptiness of the uncompounded, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, the emptiness of nonrepudiation, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of own-marks, the emptiness of nonexistence, the emptiness of own-being, and the emptiness of other-being.🔽He has fully known the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of magical power, the five dominants, the five powers, the seven limbs of enlightenment, and the holy eightfold path.🔽He has fully known the three concentrations, the four formless attainments, the four noble truths, the eight deliverances, the nine attainments of successive stations.🔽He has fully known the ten wholesome paths of action, the four trances, the four Unlimited, the four formless attainments, the five superknowledges, the five dominants, the four grounds of self-confidence, the four analytical knowledges, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the six perfections, the thirty-seven wings of enlightenment, the three doors to deliverance, the ten powers of a Tathagata, the four grounds of self-confidence, the four analytical knowledges, the eighteen special dharmas of a Buddha, the great friendliness, the great compassion, the great sympathetic joy, the great impartiality, the ten powers, the four grounds of self-confidence, the four analytical knowledges, the six superknowledges, the four unhindered knowledges, the knowledge of all modes, the knowledge of all and everything, the cognition of the knowledge of all modes, the cognition of the knowledge of paths, the cognition of the knowledge of all modes, the cognition of the knowledge of all modes, the cognition of the knowledge of all modes, the cognition of the knowledge of all

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the emptiness of emptiness.

original: chen po stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /🔽don dam pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas / don dam pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the emptiness of great extent.🔽He perfected the emptiness of ultimate reality.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /🔽'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.🔽He perfected the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /🔽thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs @358a *//
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs @358a *//
translated: He perfected the emptiness of the unlimited.🔽He perfected the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end.

original: par byas / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: par byas / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the emptiness of non-rejection.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics.

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas; ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas; ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the emptiness of non-apprehension.🔽He perfected the emptiness of essential nature.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas /🔽dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.🔽He perfected the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the four right efforts.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas /🔽dbang po lnga yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas / dbang po lnga yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the four legs of magical emanation.🔽He perfected the five faculties.

original: stobs lnga yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: stobs lnga yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the five powers.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the seven branches of enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par byas /🔽'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas /🔽bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par byas / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas / bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the noble eightfold path.🔽He perfected the four noble truths.🔽He perfected the four concentrations.

original: tshad med pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the four immeasurables.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas; rnam par thar pa brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas; rnam par thar pa brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the eight liberations.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the nine serial absorptions.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / @358b mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / @358b mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, and the wishlessness gate of liberation.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the clairvoyances.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the meditative stabilizations.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the four fearlessnesses.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas /🔽byams pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas / byams pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected the four detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽He perfected great love.

original: snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: He perfected great compassion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas shing rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas shing rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste
translated: They will perfect the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas and, with the vajra-like absorption, they will awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood through the wisdom that is concomitant with a single instant of mind.

original: / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas phyin chad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gzigs pa chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba zhes bya'o /
analyzed: / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas phyin chad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gzigs pa chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba zhes bya'o /
translated: From the time they awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood, they will be known as the thus-gone ones, the all-seeing ones, the ones who have power over all phenomena.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti then asked, “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic nature,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi /
translated: how will bodhisattva great beings purify a buddha realm?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste bdag dang / gzhan gyi lus kyi @359a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste bdag dang / gzhan gyi lus kyi @359a *//
translated: Subhūti, here, starting from the first production of the thought of awakening, bodhisattva great beings purify the physical,

original: gnas ngan len dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ste /
translated: verbal, and mental bad actions of themselves and others.

original: de yongs su dag par bya bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: de yongs su dag par bya bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: Through purifying those, they purify the buddha-field.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: lus kyi gnas ngan len ni /
analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len ni /
translated: what is the physical bad action?

original: gang lags / ngag gi gnas ngan len ni /
analyzed: gang lags / ngag gi gnas ngan len ni /
translated: What is the verbal bad action?

original: gang lags / yid kyi gnas ngan len ni /
analyzed: gang lags / yid kyi gnas ngan len ni /
translated: What is the mental bad action?”

original: gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: lus kyi las mi dge ba srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa ni /
analyzed: lus kyi las mi dge ba srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa ni /
translated: “Bodily actions that are nonvirtuous—killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct—

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi gnas ngan len to; ;ngag gi las mi dge ba brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / zhe gcod pa'i tshig dang / tshig bkyal pa ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa' ngag gi gnas ngan len to //🔽yid kyi las mi dge ba chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi gnas ngan len to; ;ngag gi las mi dge ba brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / zhe gcod pa'i tshig dang / tshig bkyal pa ni / byang chub sems dpa' ngag gi gnas ngan len to // yid kyi las mi dge ba chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba ni /
translated: The bodhisattva’s physical misdeeds are lying, slander, harsh speech, and idle talk.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi gnas ngan len to //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang ser sna'i sems ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi gnas ngan len to // rab 'byor / gzhan yang ser sna'i sems ni /
translated: The bodhisattva’s verbal misdeeds are covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi gnas ngan len to //

analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa'i sems ni / byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi gnas ngan len to //

analyzed: sems 'khrug pa gang yin pa de ni / byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi gnas ngan len to //

analyzed: le lo'i sems ni / byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi gnas ngan len to //

analyzed: g-yeng ba'i sems ni /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi gnas ngan len to //

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe gnas ngan len de dag thams cad rnam par spangs shing bdag kyang sbyin pa yongs su gtong la /

analyzed: byug pa / gnas 'dod pa la ni /

original: gnas / nor dang / 'bru dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / gser dang / dngul 'dod pa la ni /
analyzed: gnas / nor dang / 'bru dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / gser dang / dngul 'dod pa la ni /
translated: to those who want wealth, grain, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystals, corals, gold, and silver,

original: nor dang / 'bru dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / gser dang / dngul yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: nor dang / 'bru dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / gser dang / dngul yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: they give wealth, grain, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystals, corals, gold, and silver.

original: mi'i rkyen dang / yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du 'dod pa la ni /
analyzed: mi'i rkyen dang / yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du 'dod pa la ni /
translated: to those who want any human necessities and tools,

original: de dag yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: de dag yongs su gtong ste /
translated: they give them.

original: gzhan yang mi'i rkyen dang / yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du yongs su gtong ba la yang dag par skul zhing rab tu bkod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi'i rkyen dang / yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du yongs su gtong ba la yang dag par skul zhing rab tu bkod de /
translated: Moreover, they encourage and establish others in giving away any human necessities and tools.

original: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su sngo'o //
analyzed: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su sngo'o //
translated: He dedicates all his roots of virtue, shared in common with all sentient beings, to the purification of the Buddha-field.

original: de bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims srung ngo //
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims srung ngo //
translated: He himself observes morality.

original: gzhan yang tshul khrims la yang dag par skul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshul khrims la yang dag par skul lo //
translated: He encourages others to observe morality.

original: bdag kyang bzod pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: bdag kyang bzod pa bsgom mo //
translated: He himself cultivates patience.

original: gzhan yang bzod pa la yang dag par skul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang bzod pa la yang dag par skul lo //
translated: He encourages others to be patient.

original: bdag kyang brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: bdag kyang brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: He himself makes an effort at perseverance.

original: gzhan yang brtson 'grus la yang dag par skul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang brtson 'grus la yang dag par skul lo //
translated: He encourages others to make an effort at perseverance.

original: bdag kyang bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: bdag kyang bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: He himself becomes absorbed in concentration.

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan la yang dag par skul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan la yang dag par skul lo //
translated: He encourages others to become absorbed in concentration.

original: bdag kyang shes rab sgom mo //
analyzed: bdag kyang shes rab sgom mo //
translated: He himself cultivates wisdom.

original: gzhan yang shes rab la yang dag par skul zhing /🔽gzhog go / 'dul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab la yang dag par skul zhing / gzhog go / 'dul lo //
translated: He encourages others to cultivate wisdom.

original: @362b rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: @362b rab tu 'god do //
translated: He establishes them, trains them, and disciplines them.🔽He causes them to enter into the wisdom of the Buddha.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
translated: They should dedicate these roots of virtue to all sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: He dedicates those wholesome roots to the purification of the Buddha-field, making them common to all beings.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang zhing dkon mchog gsum la dbul ba byed kyang de 'di snyam du /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang zhing dkon mchog gsum la dbul ba byed kyang de 'di snyam du /
translated: He makes an offering to the Three Jewels of a world system consisting of a great trichiliocosm filled with the seven precious substances, and he thinks,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rin po che sna bdun gyi rgyu las grub par gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi spyan snga'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rin po che sna bdun gyi rgyu las grub par gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do // rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi spyan snga'am /
translated: “By these wholesome roots, may my Buddha-field be made of the essence of the seven precious substances.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten gyi drung du lha rdzas kyi rol mo brdung ba dang dkrol ba byed kyang de 'di snyem du /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten gyi drung du lha rdzas kyi rol mo brdung ba dang dkrol ba byed kyang de 'di snyem du /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when a Bodhisattva Mahāsattva plays divine music in the presence of a Buddha or in front of a stūpa of the Tathāgata, he thinks,🔽“By these wholesome roots, may I attain the sound of the Dharma in the Buddha-field where I will be a Buddha.”

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du lha rdzas kyi sgra yid du 'ong ba rtag tu rgyun mi chad par 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams lha rdzas kyi spos kyis yongs su bkang zhing sangs rgyas rnams sam /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du lha rdzas kyi sgra yid du 'ong ba rtag tu rgyun mi chad par 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do // rab 'byor / gzhan yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams lha rdzas kyi spos kyis yongs su bkang zhing sangs rgyas rnams sam /
translated: “By this wholesome root, may there always be the sound of divine music in my buddhafield.”

analyzed: de bzhin @363a *//

translated: flowers, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, banners, and lamps🔽of the gods be produced.’🔽“Furthermore, Subhūti, when the bodhisattva great being gives to the

original: rab 'byor; gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor; gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sam /
