original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten dag la lha rdzas kyi byug pa yongs su dbul bar byed kyang de 'di snyam du /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten dag la lha rdzas kyi byug pa yongs su dbul bar byed kyang de 'di snyam du /
translated: perfumes, incense,🔽flowers, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, banners, and lamps🔽of the gods be produced.’

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i sems can thams cad lha rdzas kyi reg bya dang ldan par gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i sems can thams cad lha rdzas kyi reg bya dang ldan par gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
translated: “By this wholesome root, may all the sentient beings in my Buddha-field, when I have attained highest genuine full Awakening, have divine touch.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'di snyam du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'di snyam du /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the thought occurs to the bodhisattva great being:

original: yid kyis bsam pa tsam gyis yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang / sems can thams cad la dbul zhing yongs su btang bar bya'o //🔽snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yid kyis bsam pa tsam gyis yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang / sems can thams cad la dbul zhing yongs su btang bar bya'o // snyam du sems te /
translated: “With just a thought, may I give and offer to the lord buddhas, śrāvakas, and all sentient beings whatever is desirable—forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.”

original: de de ltar sems pa'i tshe 'di snyam du /
analyzed: de de ltar sems pa'i tshe 'di snyam du /
translated: When he thinks like that, the thought occurs to him:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der bdag bla na med pa yang dag par @363b rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun du bcas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyang yid kyis bsams pa tsam gyis yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs dang //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der bdag bla na med pa yang dag par @363b rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun du bcas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyang yid kyis bsams pa tsam gyis yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs dang //
translated: By this wholesome root, when I have attained highest genuine full Awakening, in that Buddha-field, may I, together with the community of Śrāvakas, and all sentient beings, have whatever desirable forms,

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg yongs su grub par gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg yongs su grub par gyur cig ces bya bar sems bskyed do //
translated: sounds, smells, tastes, and tangibles we think of, just by thinking of them.

analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom think like this,

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang bsam gtan dang po la mnyam par bzhag go /
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang bsam gtan dang po la mnyam par bzhag go /
translated: ‘I myself will enter into the first concentration,

original: sems can thams cad kyang bsam gtan dang po la dgod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang bsam gtan dang po la dgod do //
translated: and I will establish all sentient beings in the first concentration.’

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang bsam gtan gnyis pa la mnyam par gzhag go /
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang bsam gtan gnyis pa la mnyam par gzhag go /
translated: Now I will enter into the second concentration myself.”

original: sems can thams cad kyang bsam gtan gnyis pa la dgod do //🔽ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang bsam gtan gsum pa la mnyam par bzhag go /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang bsam gtan gnyis pa la dgod do // ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang bsam gtan gsum pa la mnyam par bzhag go /
translated: I will now enter into the second concentration myself and establish all sentient beings in the second concentration.

original: sems can thams cad kyang bsam gtan gsum pa la dgod do //🔽ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa la mnyam par gzhag go /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang bsam gtan gsum pa la dgod do // ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa la mnyam par gzhag go /
translated: I will now enter into the third concentration myself and establish all sentient beings in the third concentration.

original: sems can thams cad kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa la dgod do //🔽ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang byams pa la mnyam par gzhag go /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa la dgod do // ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang byams pa la mnyam par gzhag go /
translated: I will now enter into the fourth concentration myself and establish all sentient beings in the fourth concentration.

original: sems can thams cad kyang byams pa la dgod do //🔽ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang snying rje la mnyam par gzhag go /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang byams pa la dgod do // ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang snying rje la mnyam par gzhag go /
translated: I will now enter into loving kindness myself and establish all sentient beings in loving kindness.

original: sems can thams cad kyang snying rje la dgod do //🔽ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang dga' ba la mnyam par gzhag go /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang snying rje la dgod do // ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang dga' ba la mnyam par gzhag go /
translated: I will now enter into compassion myself and establish all sentient beings in compassion.

original: sems can thams cad @364a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad @364a *//
translated: I will now enter into joy myself and establish all sentient beings in joy.🔽I will now enter into equanimity myself and establish all sentient beings in equanimity.

analyzed: kyang dga' ba la dgod do // ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang btang snyoms la mnyam par gzhag go /

analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la mnyam par bzhag go /
translated: I will

original: sems can thams cad kyang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la dgod do //🔽ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la dgod do // ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: I will establish all sentient beings in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: sems can thams cad kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la dgod do //🔽ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang yang dag par spong ba rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la dgod do // ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang yang dag par spong ba rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: I will cultivate the applications of mindfulness myself and establish all sentient beings in the applications of mindfulness.

original: sems can thams cad kyang yang dag par spong ba rnams la dgod do //🔽ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang yang dag par spong ba rnams la dgod do // ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: I will cultivate the right efforts myself and establish all sentient beings in the right efforts.

original: sems can thams cad kyang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la dgod do //🔽ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang dbang po rnams bsgom par @364b bya'o; ;sems can thams cad kyang dbang po rnams la dgod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la dgod do // ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang dbang po rnams bsgom par @364b bya'o; ;sems can thams cad kyang dbang po rnams la dgod do //
translated: I will cultivate the bases of supernatural power myself and establish all sentient beings in the bases of supernatural power.🔽I will cultivate the faculties myself and establish all sentient beings in the faculties.

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang stobs rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang stobs rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: I will cultivate the powers myself and establish all sentient beings in the powers.

original: sems can thams cad kyang stobs rnams la dgod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang stobs rnams la dgod do //
translated: I will establish all sentient beings in the powers.

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang byang chub kyi yan lag rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang byang chub kyi yan lag rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: I myself will cultivate the branches of enlightenment.

original: sems can thams cad kyang byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la dgod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la dgod do //
translated: I will establish all sentient beings in the branches of enlightenment.

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: I myself will cultivate the noble eightfold path.

original: sems can thams cad kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la dgod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la dgod do //
translated: I will establish all sentient beings in the noble eightfold path.

original: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ma la bdag nyid kyis kyang rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: I myself will cultivate the emptiness gate of liberation, the signless gate of liberation, and the wishless gate of liberation.

original: sems can thams cad kyang rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la dgod do snyam ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la dgod do snyam ste /
translated: I will establish all sentient beings in the emptiness gate of liberation, the signless gate of liberation, and the wishless gate of liberation.

original: de de ltar sems pa'i tshe de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i sems can thams cad bsam gtan bzhi dang mi 'bral zhing
analyzed: de de ltar sems pa'i tshe de 'di snyam du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i sems can thams cad bsam gtan bzhi dang mi 'bral zhing
translated: When they think like that, they should think, ‘By this wholesome root, may all the sentient beings in that buddha-field where I have awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood not be separated from the four concentrations,

original: / tshad med pa bzhi dang mi 'bral ba dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: / tshad med pa bzhi dang mi 'bral ba dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: not be separated from the four immeasurables, not be separated from the four formless absorptions, not be separated from the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, and not be separated from the emptiness gate to liberation, the signlessness gate to liberation, and the

original: smon pa med pa dag dang mi 'bral bar shog cig ces bya bar sems skyed do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dag dang mi 'bral bar shog cig ces bya bar sems skyed do //
translated: wishlessness gate to liberation.’

original: rab 'byor / de de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @365a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @365a *//
translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed /
translated: practicing the perfection of wisdom like that purify a buddha-field,

original: de nas bsam pa de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur gyi bar du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste /
analyzed: de nas bsam pa de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur gyi bar du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste /
translated: and until all those thoughts are completely fulfilled, he will not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de bdag nyid kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang ldan pa yin /
translated: He himself will be endowed with all the roots of virtue.

original: sems can thams cad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa yin /
translated: All sentient beings will be endowed with the roots of virtue.

original: sems can de dag thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan par byad pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan par byad pa yin te /
translated: He will endow all those sentient beings with the roots of virtue.

original: de bdag nyid kyi lus kyang mdzes pa yin /🔽sems can gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des yongs su smin par byas pa de dag kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyi lus kyang mdzes pa yin / sems can gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des yongs su smin par byas pa de dag kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: His own body will be beautiful.

original: bsod nams kyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir gzugs bzang zhing mdzes la yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs mngon par 'grub ste; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bsod nams kyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir gzugs bzang zhing mdzes la yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs mngon par 'grub ste; rab 'byor /
translated: Those sentient beings who have been ripened by that bodhisattva great being will also have a beautiful, good-looking, attractive form, because they will be held by merit.🔽Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: bodhisattva great beings

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ltar yongs su dag par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ltar yongs su dag par byed de /
translated: He purifies the buddhafield in such a way that even the names of the three lower realms will not exist,

original: ci nas kyang ngan song gsum du gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / lta bar rnam par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug tu gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang /
analyzed: ci nas kyang ngan song gsum du gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / lta bar rnam par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug tu gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang /
translated: that even the names of the designations of views will not exist, that even the names of the designations of desire, hatred, and ignorance will not exist,

original: bud med dang / skyes par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / theg pa gnyis su gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang /
analyzed: bud med dang / skyes par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / theg pa gnyis su gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang /
translated: that even the names of the designations of women and men will not exist, that even the names of the designations of the two vehicles will not exist, and that even the names of the designations of impermanence, suffering, and no-self will not exist.

original: yongs @365b su 'dzin par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / bdag dang bdag gir bya bar gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas ldang bar gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / phyin ci log tu gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang /
analyzed: yongs @365b su 'dzin par gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / bdag dang bdag gir bya bar gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas ldang bar gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang / phyin ci log tu gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid pa dang /
translated: the designation of grasping at all would be impossible, the designation of self and entities connected to the self would be impossible, the designation of latent tendencies and the thoroughly afflicted would be impossible, the designation of error would be impossible,

original: 'bras bur gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid cing /🔽gzhan du na sems can de dag 'dod pa bzhin du shing rlung gis btab pa'am; phyi nang gi dngos po dag las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bur gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid cing / gzhan du na sems can de dag 'dod pa bzhin du shing rlung gis btab pa'am; phyi nang gi dngos po dag las 'di lta ste /
translated: and the designation of results would be impossible.

original: stong pa nyid kyi sgra dang / mtshan ma med pa'i sgra dang / smon pa med pa'i sgra dang / mi skye mi 'gag pa'i sgra dang / chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgra dang / chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong pa'i sgra 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi sgra dang / mtshan ma med pa'i sgra dang / smon pa med pa'i sgra dang / mi skye mi 'gag pa'i sgra dang / chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgra dang / chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong pa'i sgra 'byung ba dang /
translated: Otherwise, the sound of emptiness, the sound of signlessness, the sound of wishlessness, the sound of nonarising and noncessation, the sound of all phenomena being essenceless, and the sound of all phenomena being empty of all phenomena would arise from the trees being struck by the wind or from outer and inner things, just as sentient beings wish.

original: chos de dag gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgra dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: chos de dag gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgra dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: The sound of the teaching of the non-entityness of those phenomena just as they are,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: whether the Tathāgatas have arisen or have not arisen,

original: chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong ngo //
translated: all phenomena are empty of all phenomena.

original: gang stong pa de la ni /
analyzed: gang stong pa de la ni /
translated: That which is empty

original: mtshan ma med do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med do //
translated: has no mark.

original: gang la mtshan ma med pa de la ni /
analyzed: gang la mtshan ma med pa de la ni /
translated: That which has no mark

original: smon pa med do //
analyzed: smon pa med do //
translated: has no wish.

original: zhes bya bar chos bstan pa'i sgra nyin mtshan rgyun mi chad par 'gro'ang rung /🔽'dug kyang rung /
analyzed: zhes bya bar chos bstan pa'i sgra nyin mtshan rgyun mi chad par 'gro'ang rung / 'dug kyang rung /
translated: The sound of the teaching of the Dharma like that continuously day and night, whether walking,🔽whether standing,

original: sdod kyang rung /
analyzed: sdod kyang rung /
translated: whether sitting,

original: nyal yang rung ste /
analyzed: nyal yang rung ste /
translated: whether lying down,

original: rtag tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta bur sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ngo //
analyzed: rtag tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta bur sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ngo //
translated: is always present. In that way they purify a buddhafield.

original: de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra @366a *//
analyzed: de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra @366a *//
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in that kind of buddhafield, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Per-

original: bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de thams cad legs pa brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de thams cad legs pa brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: All the blessed buddhas in the worlds of the ten directions will praise him.🔽All those beings who hear the name of that thus-gone one will be certain to attain unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: sems can gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa de'i mtshan thos pa de thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur te; de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas des chos bstan pa na
analyzed: sems can gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa de'i mtshan thos pa de thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur te; de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas des chos bstan pa na
translated: When that thus-gone one, the worthy one, the perfect buddha, teaches the Dharma,

original: / sems can gang yang 'di ni /
analyzed: / sems can gang yang 'di ni /
translated: no being will have any doubt

original: chos so // 'di ni /
analyzed: chos so // 'di ni /
translated: about whether something is the Dharma

original: chos ma yin no //🔽zhes bya bar the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos ma yin no // zhes bya bar the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or not the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni / 'di ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la ni /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la ni /
translated: Because in the true nature of phenomena,

original: chos ma yin pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa gang yang med de /
translated: there is nothing that is not the Dharma.

original: thams cad kyang chos so //
analyzed: thams cad kyang chos so //
translated: Everything is the Dharma.

original: de la sems can gang mi dge ba'i rtsa bas non pa dang / sangs rgyas sam sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa bdag tu lta bar byed pa nas lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyi bar du bying ba /
analyzed: de la sems can gang mi dge ba'i rtsa bas non pa dang / sangs rgyas sam sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa bdag tu lta bar byed pa nas lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyi bar du bying ba /
translated: “There are sentient beings who are overcome by the roots of nonvirtue, who have not planted the roots of virtue with the buddhas or the buddhas’ śrāvakas, who are under the care of nonvirtuous friends, who are mired in the view of self, and who are mired in all views.

original: rtag pa'am chad pa'i mtha' la gnas pa /🔽log par 'dzin pas yang dag par rdzogs ba'i sangs rgyas ma yin pa la ni /
analyzed: rtag pa'am chad pa'i mtha' la gnas pa / log par 'dzin pas yang dag par rdzogs ba'i sangs rgyas ma yin pa la ni /
translated: They abide in the extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin par 'du shes pa /🔽yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin pa la ni /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin par 'du shes pa / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin pa la ni /
translated: They have wrong views, and so they think that those who are not perfectly awakened are perfectly awakened.🔽They think that those who are perfectly awakened are not perfectly awakened.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin par 'du shes pa de @366b dag ni; chos ma yin pa la'ang chos so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin par 'du shes pa de @366b dag ni; chos ma yin pa la'ang chos so //
translated: They say that what is not the Dharma is the Dharma,

original: zhes zer / chos la'ang chos ma yin no //🔽zhes zer te /
analyzed: zhes zer / chos la'ang chos ma yin no // zhes zer te /
translated: and that the Dharma is not the Dharma.

original: de dag chos la spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag chos la spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: They reject the Dharma.

original: de ltar chos spangs nas lus zhig pa'i 'og tu shi nas ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar chos spangs nas lus zhig pa'i 'og tu shi nas ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Having abandoned the Dharma in that way, after the body has perished, they will die and be reborn in the lower realms, in the evil destinies, in the lower miserable destinies, in the hells.

original: de lta bu dag la'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing /
analyzed: de lta bu dag la'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing /
translated: Even to those like that, the Lord Buddhas, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: 'khor ba'i khongs su chud pa'i sems can de dag sdig par lta bu'i rnam pa de dag las rnam par 'grol te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i khongs su chud pa'i sems can de dag sdig par lta bu'i rnam pa de dag las rnam par 'grol te /
translated: liberate those beings who are within the range of saṃsāra from those kinds of evil views.

original: de ltar rnam par bkrol nas nges pa'i phung por rab tu 'god de /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par bkrol nas nges pa'i phung por rab tu 'god de /
translated: Having liberated them in that way, they establish them in the secure state.

original: der bkod pa rnams phyin chad ngan song du ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der bkod pa rnams phyin chad ngan song du ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have been established there will not fall to the lower realms from then on.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, in that way

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa yin te /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings purify a buddhafield.

original: de ltar yongs su sbyangs pas sems can rnams 'jig rten pa'i chos sam /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su sbyangs pas sems can rnams 'jig rten pa'i chos sam /
translated: Through such thorough training, bodhisattvas bring sentient beings to maturity in two ways.🔽

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos sam /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos sam /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos sam / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos sam /
translated: Through such thorough training, they will not settle down on any phenomenon, whether mundane or supramundane,

original: zag pa med pa'i chos sam /🔽'dus byas kyi chos sam /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos sam / 'dus byas kyi chos sam /
translated: whether contaminated or uncontaminated,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang la'ang gnas par mi 'gyur te /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du nges par 'gyur ro; ;shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang la'ang gnas par mi 'gyur te / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du nges par 'gyur ro; ;shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: whether conditioned or unconditioned,

original: le'u drug cu rtsa bdun pa'o ////🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽@367a *// bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges zhes bgyi'am /🔽ma nges zhes bgyi /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /🔽nges pa ste /
analyzed: le'u drug cu rtsa bdun pa'o ////🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽@367a *// bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges zhes bgyi'am /🔽ma nges zhes bgyi /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /🔽nges pa ste /
translated: up to and including unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not indefinite.🔽”

original: gsol pa / nyan thos kyi phung po'am /🔽rang sangs rgyas kyi phung po'am /
analyzed: gsol pa / nyan thos kyi phung po'am / rang sangs rgyas kyi phung po'am /
translated: He asked, “Is it definite in the śrāvaka heap,🔽or in the pratyekabuddha heap,

original: sangs rgyas kyi phung po'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phung po'am /
translated: or in the Buddha heap,

original: phung po gang du nges pa lags /
analyzed: phung po gang du nges pa lags /
translated: or in which heap is it definite?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /🔽nyan thos kyi phung por nges pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni / nyan thos kyi phung por nges pa'am /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings🔽are not definite in the śrāvaka heap

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi phung por nges pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi phung por nges pa ma yin gyi /
translated: or in the pratyekabuddha heap,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: but, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings

original: sangs rgyas kyi phung por nges pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phung por nges pa'o //
translated: are definite in the Buddha heap.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked, “Lord,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges zhes bgyi'am /
translated: is the bodhisattva great being who has produced the first thought definite,

original: 'on tam phyir mi ldog pa nges zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: 'on tam phyir mi ldog pa nges zhes bgyi'am /
translated: or is the irreversible one definite,

original: 'on tam srid pa tha ma pa nges zhes bgyi /
analyzed: 'on tam srid pa tha ma pa nges zhes bgyi /
translated: or is the one in his last existence definite?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who has generated the first level of bodhicitta is

original: nges pa'o // phyir mi ldog pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa'o // phyir mi ldog pa ni /
translated: definite. The irreversible one is

original: nges pa'o // srid pa gcig gis thogs pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa'o // srid pa gcig gis thogs pa ni /
translated: definite. The one who is impeded by one birth is🔽definite.

original: nges pa'o; ;gsol pa /
analyzed: nges pa'o; ;gsol pa /
translated: He said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur /
translated: will the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is definite be born in the lower realms or not?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: @367b rab 'byor /
analyzed: @367b rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: de ni / ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni / ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: rab 'byor / nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is definite

original: ngan song du mi skye'o //
analyzed: ngan song du mi skye'o //
translated: will not be born in the lower realms.

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: brgyad pa'am / rgyun du zhugs pa'am; lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: brgyad pa'am / rgyun du zhugs pa'am; lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'am /
translated: Will the one on the eighth [stage], the stream-enterer, the once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'am /🔽dgra bcom pa'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'am / dgra bcom pa'am /
translated: the non-returner,

original: rang sangs rgyas ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: the arhat, or the pratyekabuddha be born in the lower realms?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: de ni / ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni / ma lags so //
translated: that is not so.”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽🔽

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste sbyin pa gtong ba dang / tshul khrims srung ba dang / bzod pa sgrub pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste sbyin pa gtong ba dang / tshul khrims srung ba dang / bzod pa sgrub pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, it is impossible that a bodhisattva great being who, from the first production of the thought of awakening onward, gives gifts, guards morality, perfects patience, exerts vigor,

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab sgom pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spang ba'i don du gnas pa de ni /🔽ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab sgom pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spang ba'i don du gnas pa de ni / ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba'i gnas med do //
translated: enters into meditative concentration, cultivates wisdom, and abides for the sake of abandoning all nonvirtuous qualities🔽will be reborn in the lower realms.

original: lha tshe ring por skye ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: lha tshe ring por skye ba'i gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible that he will be reborn among the long-lived gods.

original: gang na dge ba'i chos rnams mi spyod pa de lta bu skye ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: gang na dge ba'i chos rnams mi spyod pa de lta bu skye ba'i gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible that he will be reborn in a place where virtuous qualities are not practiced.

original: glen pa dang lkug par 'gyur ba'i yul du skye ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: glen pa dang lkug par 'gyur ba'i yul du skye ba'i gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible that he will be reborn in a place where he will be stupid and mute.

original: mtha' 'khob kyi kla klo dang mi srun zhing 'khor bzhi rgyur med pa'i yul du skye ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: mtha' 'khob kyi kla klo dang mi srun zhing 'khor bzhi rgyur med pa'i yul du skye ba'i gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible that he will be reborn in a border region among barbarians who are unruly and do not have the fourfold retinue.

original: log par lta ba'i rigs su skye ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i rigs su skye ba'i gnas med do //
translated: there is no place of rebirth in the class of those with wrong views.

original: gang na sangs rgyas kyi sgra mi grag pa dang / chos kyi sgra mi grag pa dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra mi grag pa de lta bur skye ba'i gnas med do //🔽bya ba ma yin pa'i lta bar ltung ba'i @368a *//
analyzed: gang na sangs rgyas kyi sgra mi grag pa dang / chos kyi sgra mi grag pa dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra mi grag pa de lta bur skye ba'i gnas med do // bya ba ma yin pa'i lta bar ltung ba'i @368a *//
translated: there is no place of rebirth where the sound of the Buddha is not heard, where the sound of the Dharma is not heard, and where the sound of the Saṅgha is not heard.

original: gnas med do //
analyzed: gnas med do //
translated: there is no place of rebirth in a downfall of non-virtuous views.🔽there is no place of rebirth in a downfall of non-virtuous actions.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pas yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag pa'i bsam pas yang dag par zhugs pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, from the time when a bodhisattva great being first produces the thought, having entered into the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening with an altruistic intention,

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la spyod ces bya ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la spyod ces bya ba'i gnas med do //
translated: there is no place of rebirth in the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Bhagavān,

original: gal te de ltar nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta bu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: gal te de ltar nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta bu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan zhing /
translated: if it is so that a bodhisattva great being who is definite like that, who has such wholesome roots,

original: tshul dang mi 'dra ba'i gnas su mi skye ba lags na /
analyzed: tshul dang mi 'dra ba'i gnas su mi skye ba lags na /
translated: is not reborn in an inappropriate place,

original: gang 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyang byol song gi rgyud du skyes pa'i rabs bstan na /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyang byol song gi rgyud du skyes pa'i rabs bstan na /
translated: If the Tathāgata himself taught the life stories of those who were born in the animal realm,

original: de'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gang du mchis /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gang du mchis /
translated: then where did those roots of virtue go?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: “Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings

original: mi dge ba'i las kyis byol song gi rgyud du skye ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyis byol song gi rgyud du skye ba ma yin gyi /
translated: are not born in the animal realm due to non-virtuous actions.

original: lus gang dang gang gis sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba de dang de lta bu'i lus ched du bsams shing sems can rnams kyi don du skye ba yongs su 'dzin cing /
analyzed: lus gang dang gang gis sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba de dang de lta bu'i lus ched du bsams shing sems can rnams kyi don du skye ba yongs su 'dzin cing /
translated: They deliberately assume any kind of body that will benefit sentient beings, and they take birth for the sake of sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar thabs mkhas pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byol song gi skye gnas su skyes shing de la la la zhig gsod du 'ongs kyang bla na med pa'i bzod pas bdag yongs su gtong zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar thabs mkhas pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byol song gi skye gnas su skyes shing de la la la zhig gsod du 'ongs kyang bla na med pa'i bzod pas bdag yongs su gtong zhing /
translated: Su­bhūti, in this way, through skillful means, great bodhisattva beings who have taken birth in the animal realm, even if someone comes to kill them, give themselves up with unsurpassed patience.

original: sems can de dag la gnod par mi byed pa de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa dag dgra bcom @368b pa'am; rang sangs rgyas dag la yod dam /
analyzed: sems can de dag la gnod par mi byed pa de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa dag dgra bcom @368b pa'am; rang sangs rgyas dag la yod dam /
translated: Do the Arhats or Pratyekabuddhas have such skillful means as not to harm those sentient beings?

original: rab 'byor / de bas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na /
translated: Subhuti, for this reason

original: rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: you should know that the Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas

original: sems can rnams kyi phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: perfect great compassion for the sake of sentient beings, for the sake of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: byol song gi skye gnas su skye'ang byol song gi skye gnas kyi rgyud kyi nyes pas mi gos par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas su skye'ang byol song gi skye gnas kyi rgyud kyi nyes pas mi gos par rig par bya'o //
translated: Even if born in the animal realm, they are not tainted by the faults of the animal realm.🔽Subhuti said:

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavan,

original: dge ba'i chos gang la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos gang la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin /
translated: what wholesome dharmas do the Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas abide in, so that they take on such a body?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavan replied:

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba'i dge ba'i chos de lta bu gang zhig yod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba'i dge ba'i chos de lta bu gang zhig yod de /
translated: There are no wholesome states that a bodhisattva great being does not complete.

original: de dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ni; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: de dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ni; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: Because all wholesome states are perfected in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du dge ba'i chos gang yang yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du dge ba'i chos gang yang yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba med do //
translated: Thus, from the first production of the thought of awakening onward, there is no wholesome state that a bodhisattva great being does not complete up to sitting on the seat of awakening.

original: dge ba'i chos gang yongs su rdzogs par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de lta bu med de /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos gang yongs su rdzogs par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de lta bu med de /
translated: There is no wholesome state that is not completed in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ni / gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni / gnas ma yin no //
translated: That is not possible.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na /
translated: Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas @369a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas @369a *//
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings, from the time they first give rise to the mind of awakening,

original: nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la bslab par bya ste /
translated: should train in perfecting all wholesome dharmas.

original: de la bslab na /
analyzed: de la bslab na /
translated: If they train in that,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob bo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob bo //
translated: they will attain the knowledge of all aspects,

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad kyang yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad kyang yongs su spong ngo //
translated: and they will also eliminate all the latencies.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti then asked, “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: how is it that

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos dkar po zag pa ma mchis pa de lta bu dang ldan pa ngan song ngam /
translated: bodhisattva great beings who possess such pure, noble dharmas without outflows could be born in the lower realms

original: byol song gi skye gnas su skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas su skye bar 'gyur /
translated: or in the animal realm?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa 'phags pa zag pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa 'phags pa zag pa med pa yin nam /
translated: are the thus-gone ones noble and without outflows?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Blessed One,

original: de de lags /
analyzed: de de lags /
translated: that is so.

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Well-Gone One,

original: de de lags te /de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de de lags te /de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: that is so. The thus-gone ones🔽are noble and without outflows.”

original: 'phags shing zag pa mi mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags shing zag pa mi mnga' ba'o //
translated: “Noble” means free from defilements.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags mngon par sprul pa mdzad cing /
translated: “Subhūti, does the Tathāgata manifest the birth of an animal,

analyzed: de mngon par sprul nas sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad pa de lta bu yod dam med /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

original: mchis so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: mchis so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /

analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa byol song gi skye gnas par 'gyur ram /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni / ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni / ma lags so //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @369b pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @369b pa; rab 'byor /
translated: The Buddha said, “Subhūti,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas byol song gi skye gnas kyi sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ram /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de lta ma lags so //
analyzed: de lta ma lags so //
translated: he does not.”🔽The Buddha said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa dang ldan pa'ang ched du bsams shing de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin te; lus de dag gis sems can rnams ci rigs ci tshul du yongs su smin par byed do
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa dang ldan pa'ang ched du bsams shing de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin te; lus de dag gis sems can rnams ci rigs ci tshul du yongs su smin par byed do
translated: Subhuti : In the same way, then, a Bodhisattva, a great being, who is endowed with the holy dharmas which are without outflows, deliberately takes on such a body, and by means of that body he brings beings to maturity in accordance with their dispositions.

original: // rab 'byor /
analyzed: // rab 'byor /
translated: In the same way, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who is endowed with the holy dharmas, which are without outflows, deliberately takes on such a body, and by means of that body he brings beings to maturity in accordance with their dispositions.

original: de ji snyom du sems /
analyzed: de ji snyom du sems /
translated: What do you think, Subhuti,

original: dgra bcom pas sprul pa mngon par sprul na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pas sprul pa mngon par sprul na /
translated: if an Arhat conjures up a magical creation,

original: sprul pa des dgra bcom pa'i las byas shing /
analyzed: sprul pa des dgra bcom pa'i las byas shing /
translated: and if that magical creation performs the actions of an Arhat,

original: las des gzhan gyi dge ba skye bar 'gyur ba yod dam /
analyzed: las des gzhan gyi dge ba skye bar 'gyur ba yod dam /
translated: and through that action causes the wholesome roots of others to grow,

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhuti:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavan,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is so.🔽Bhagavan, it is so.

original: mchis so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mchis so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavan said:

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa dang ldan pa'ang ched du bsams shing de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin te ci rigs ci tshul du sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa dang ldan pa'ang ched du bsams shing de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin te ci rigs ci tshul du sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being who has the noble dharmas without outflows deliberately takes on such a body and ripens beings in whatever way is appropriate.

original: de lta bu'i lus des sdug bsngal du'ang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lus des sdug bsngal du'ang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And with that kind of body he does not suffer,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor pa'ang nyams su mi myong ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor pa'ang nyams su mi myong ngo //
translated: and he does not experience painful feelings.

original: rab 'byor; de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor; de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan pos sgyu ma las glang po'i gzugs sam /🔽rta'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan pos sgyu ma las glang po'i gzugs sam / rta'i gzugs sam /
translated: If a magician conjures up the form of an elephant,🔽the form of a horse,

original: glang gi gzugs shig bstan tam /
analyzed: glang gi gzugs shig bstan tam /
translated: or the form of a bull,

original: gzhan yang sgyu ma rnam pa sna tshogs @370a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang sgyu ma rnam pa sna tshogs @370a *//
translated: or if he conjures up various other illusions,

original: bstan na / de dag glang po'i gzugs sam /🔽rta'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: bstan na / de dag glang po'i gzugs sam / rta'i gzugs sam /
translated: do those forms of an elephant,🔽the form of a horse,

original: glang gi gzugs sam /
analyzed: glang gi gzugs sam /
translated: the form of a bull,

original: srog chags kyi rigs gzhan dag tu'ang 'gyur ba yod dam /🔽gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: srog chags kyi rigs gzhan dag tu'ang 'gyur ba yod dam / gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: or the forms of other kinds of living creatures exist?

original: de ni / ma mchis so //
analyzed: de ni / ma mchis so //
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa dang ldan pa'ang ched du bsams shing de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa dang ldan pa'ang ched du bsams shing de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, even though bodhisattva great beings possess the noble dharmas that are uncontaminated, they deliberately take on such bodies.

original: lus de dag gis sems can rnams kyi don byed de /
analyzed: lus de dag gis sems can rnams kyi don byed de /
translated: With those bodies they work for the welfare of sentient beings,🔽but they do not experience any suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor bar 'gyur ba gang yang med do; ;rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor bar 'gyur ba gang yang med do; ;rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: ” Subhūti said,🔽“Oh, Blessed One!

original: kye ma bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: kye ma bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Oh, Blessed One!

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i ye shes zag pa ma mchis pa dang de ltar ldan zhing lus gang dang gang gis sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba de dang de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i ye shes zag pa ma mchis pa dang de ltar ldan zhing lus gang dang gang gis sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba de dang de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin pa ni /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who possess the noble uncontaminated wisdom and who take on whatever bodies are necessary to work for the welfare of sentient beings

original: thabs shin tu mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: thabs shin tu mkhas pa ste /
translated: are very skilled in means.

original: de ni / ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: de ni / ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: That is amazing!

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos dkar po gang dang gang la gnas shing de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa bgyid kyang las de lta bus mi gos par spyod pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos dkar po gang dang gang la gnas shing de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa bgyid kyang las de lta bus mi gos par spyod pa lags /
translated: “What are the wholesome dharmas on which the bodhisattva great beings stand, and with what kind of skillful means do they practice without being defiled by such actions?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa la spyod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta bu'i thabs mkhas pa la spyod de /
translated: “Subhūti, standing in the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva great beings practice with such skillful means.

original: @370b thabs mkhas pa de dag gis phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang des de la gang yang reg par 'gyur ba med do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @370b thabs mkhas pa de dag gis phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang des de la gang yang reg par 'gyur ba med do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: With those skillful means they work for the welfare of beings in world systems in each of the ten directions as numerous as the sands of the River Ganges, but nothing at all touches them. And why is that?

original: de ni / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang reg par byed pa dang / gang gis reg par bya ba dang / gang la reg par bya ba de lta bu'i chos gsum po de dag thams cad mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang reg par byed pa dang / gang gis reg par bya ba dang / gang la reg par bya ba de lta bu'i chos gsum po de dag thams cad mi dmigs te /
translated: Because the Bodhisattva Mahasattva does not apprehend any of the three dharmas, namely, that which touches, that by which one touches, and that on which one touches.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni / 'di ltar chos gsum po de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar chos gsum po de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas /
translated: Because all three of those dharmas are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni /
translated: Emptiness

original: stong pa nyid la reg par mi byed do; ;stong pa nyid kyis chos gang la'ang reg par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la reg par mi byed do; ;stong pa nyid kyis chos gang la'ang reg par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: does not touch emptiness. Emptiness does not touch any dharma at all.

original: stong pa nyid kyang reg par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang reg par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness is not something that can be touched.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni / 'di ltar stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid mi dmigs so //
translated: Because emptiness does not apprehend emptiness.

original: de ni; mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni; mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: That is the emptiness of non-apprehension.
